intro: Gilia congesta var. nuda, commonly known as the naked gilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and showy, clustered flowers. The flowers are typically pink to red in color and bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant thrives in dry, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. It is an annual plant that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds.
